intro: Stellaster pratensis, commonly known as the meadow star, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. Stellaster pratensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
